UI_default.name: UI_default
UI_default.description: The simplest default UI implementation. Implemented UI functionalities for: showSelections, highlightSelectedObject

as soon as we refactor the animations and graphics for selections

baseEventlisteners.name: baseEventlisteners
baseEventlisteners.description: Core plugin. Houses the default eventlisteners used in the map. When plugins are added to the map this class can be used for the eventlistener management.

params.name: canvasElement
params.description: The canvas element we listen events from. Will try to search the first canvas in the DOM, if none is provided

mapDrag.name: mapDrag
mapDrag.description: Core plugin for the engine. Handles moving the map by dragging the map with mouse or touch event. Core plugins can always be overwrote if needed.

utils.Quadtree.name: utils.Quadtree
utils.Quadtree.description:
NOTE! NOT IN USE AT THE MOMENT. THIS WAS LESS EFFICIENT THAN USING SUBCONTAINERS, SO IT WILL BE USED IN THE FUTURE IF NEEDED.

This class handles the API for quadtree to search for the wanted objects on the certain coordinates. After this
the map should do it's own - more precise - hit detections.
requires: Quadtree-js. Though this base library can be changed easily

params.name: options
params.description: options for the QuadModule

params.name: max
params.description: How many levels deep

utils.dataManipulation.name: utils.dataManipulation
utils.dataManipulation.description: These are utils for manipulating the data, that our classes and functions use.

utils.effects.name: utils.effects
utils.effects.description:
This module will hold the most common graphical effects used in the map. It is still very stub as the development
hasn't proceeded to this stage yet.

mapZoom.name: mapZoom
mapZoom.description: Core plugin for the engine. Handles zooming for the map. Core plugins can always be overwrote if needed. Zooming happens when the user scrolls the mousewheel or in mobile, pinches the screen.

Map.name: Map
Map.description:
#Main class for the engine

Initializes the whole structure and plugins and is used as primary API for all operations. This class is e.g. passed to every plugin that get initialized with their init-method.

You use the class by instantiating it (new) and then finishing initialization with init-method. Please see examples below.

The biggest part of creating the map, is the data structure. There is a clear data structure that you can see from the tests/data-folder, but the factory is responsible for creating the objects, so you can use your own factory implementation. So to understand more, please see e.g. factories.horizontalHexaFactory.

The map consists of layer on top of each other. The example is best understood when thinking typical war strategy game. The structure is this:
1. StaticLayer: Handles things like scaling / zooming the map
2. MovableLayer: Obviously handles movement of the map. Also is a good place to get map coordinates. Since getting global coordinates won't help you much, half of the time.
3. Different layers: like units, terrain, fog of war, UIs etc. Can also contains special layers like dynamically changed UIlayers.
4. possible subcontainers (used for optimized object selection and map movement). Can also contains special layers like dynamically changed UIlayers.
5. Individual objects, like units, terrains, cities etc...

Plugins can be added with activatePlugins-method by sending them to the class. Plugins must always implement init-method, which receives Map instance. Plugins are not yet restricted what they can do and can add functionality without touching map or can modify objects or their prototypes through access to Map instance.
example:
var map = new Map(divContainer, mapOptions );
    promises = map.init( gameData.pluginsToActivate, mapData.startPoint );

params.name: canvasContainer
params.description: HTML element which will be container for the created canvas element. REQUIRED

params.name: props
params.description: Extra properties

props.name: subcontainers
props.description: Subcontainers size in pixels. If given, will activate subcontainers. If not given or false, subcontainers are not used.area.

params.name: trackFPSCB
params.description: Callback function for tracking FPS in renderer. So this is used for debugging and optimizing.

MapDataManipulator.name: MapDataManipulator
MapDataManipulator.description: Class to get a consistent standard for the engine to be able to filter objects, when retrieving or sorting them.

params.name: rules
params.description: REQUIRED. The rules that apply for this instance. Multiple rules in Array or one as Object.

MapLayer.name: MapLayer
MapLayer.description: Creates a basic layer for the Map. This type of layer can not hold subcontainers. Note that different devices and graphic cards can only have specific size of bitmap drawn, and PIXI cache always draws a bitmap thus the default is: 4096, based on this site: http://webglstats.com/ and MAX_TEXTURE_SIZE. This is important also when caching.

params.name: options
params.description: optional options

props.name: name
props.description: Layers name, used for identifying the layer. Useful in debugging, but can be used for finding correct layers too

props.name: coord
props.description: coord starting coords of layer. Relative to parent map layer.

props.name: specialLayer
props.description: Is this layer special (e.g. UILayer not included in normal operations)

MapLayerParent.name: MapLayerParent
MapLayerParent.description: Layer designed to hold subcontainers. But can handle objects too. Different devices graphic cards can only have specific size of bitmap drawn, and PIXI cache always draws a bitmap. Thus the default is: 4096, based on this site: http://webglstats.com/ and MAX_TEXTURE_SIZE

props.name: name
props.description: name layer property name, used for identifiying the layer, usefull in debugging, but used also otherwise too

props.name: coord
props.description: starting coords of layer. Relative to parent map layer.

props.name: subcontainers
props.description: Subontainer size. If given activated subcontainers, otherwise not.

props.name: specialLayer
props.description: Is this special layer or not.

MapSubcontainer.name: MapSubcontainer
MapSubcontainer.description: Subcontainers are containers that hold objects like units and terrain etc. under them. They have some restrictions atm. since they are PIXI.ParticleContainers. But when needed we can extend MapLayers with another class which is subcontainer, but not ParticleContainer at the present there is no need, so we won't extend yet. Subcontainers help the layers to make better movement of the map, by making subcontainers visible or invisible and even helping with selecting objects on the map. Thus we don't need to use our inefficient Quadtree. The intention was to use PIXI.ParticleContainer for this, but it seems it doesn't clean up the memory afterwards the same way as normal Container.

params.name: size
params.description: Subontainer size. If given activated subcontainers, otherwise not.

ObjectManager.name: ObjectManager
ObjectManager.description: this module is responsible for doing hitTesting, like returning the units on certain clicked coordinates or when objects or areas collide with each other.

params.name: hitDetector
params.description: Object or function that handles hit detection. This can be omitted in many cases

todo: It might be a good idea to make the hitDetection more extensive. Now it just uses point or rectangle / bounds to detect hits. It could use sprites or forms.

Object_sprite.name: Object_sprite
Object_sprite.description: The base class of all sprite objects

params.name: coords
params.description: the coordinate where the object is located at, relative to it's parent

params.name: data
params.description: objects data, that will be used in the game. It will not actually be mainly used in graphical but rather things  like unit-data and city-data presentations etc.

params.name: options.currFrame
params.description: currFrame the current frames number. This is basically the initial image, we can change it later for animation or such

ObjectSpriteTerrain.name: ObjectSpriteTerrain
ObjectSpriteTerrain.description:
Terrain tile like desert or mountain, non-movable and cacheable. Normally, but not necessarily, these are
inherited, depending on the map type. For example you might want to add some click area for these

params.name: coords
params.description: format: {x: Number, y: Number}. Coordinates for the object relative to it's parent

params.name: data
params.description: This units custom data

params.name: options
params.description: other specific options for constructing this terrain

ObjectSpriteUnit.name: ObjectSpriteUnit
ObjectSpriteUnit.description: Map unit like infantry or worker, usually something with actions or movable. Usually these are extended, depending on the map type. For example you might want to add some click area for these (e.g. hexagon)

params.name: coords
params.description: Coordinates for the object relative to it's parent

params.name: data
params.description: This units data

params.name: options
params.description: other specific options for constructing this unit, like options.throwShadow

props.name: throwShadow
props.description: Can we throw a shadow under this object

UI.name: UI
UI.description:
Main class for showing UI on the map. Like unit selections and such. Has nothing to do with showing off-map data.
Good examples for what this shows are: selected units-list, selection highlight (like a circle on the selected unit) and bringing the unit on top in the map. UI themes must implement this core UI module
todo: Not implemented fully yet and probably need refactoring

params.name: UITheme
params.description: Module that will be used for the UI theme

params.name: givenMap
params.description: Map instance that is used

UI_templateBase.name: UI_templateBase
UI_templateBase.description: The template base class for UI templates
todo: This needs a bit of redesign.

eventListeners.name: eventListeners
eventListeners.description: This keeps all the event listeners and detectors in one class. You add detectors / event listener types with addDetector and you add event listeners with on.

mapEvents.name: mapEvents
mapEvents.description:
This module handles map events. Like informing map movement, object selection and other changes.
Events atm:
- mapMoved
- mapResize
- mapFullscreeActivated
todo: I want the pubsub module to go the ES6 way

so we need it to handle those events correctly

Plugins to be activated for the map. Normally you should give the plugins here
instead of separately passing them to activatePlugins method. You can provide the module strings or module objects.

return.description: Returns an array of Promises. If this is empty / zero. Then there is nothing to wait for, if it contains promises, you have to wait for them to finish for the plugins to work and map be ready.

So this is used for things that are relative to the current map position the player is seeing. This can be used e.g. when you want to display some objects on the map or UI elements, like effects that happen on certain point on the map.

classitems.description: Layers name, used for identifying the layer. Useful in debugging, but can be used for finding correct layers too

classitems.description: Move layer based on given amounts

params.name: coord
params.description: The amount of x and y coordinates we want the layer to move. I.e. { x: 5, y: 0 }. This would move the map 5 pixels horizontally and 0 pixels vertically

classitems.description:
Responsible for showing selection element, where the player select the wanted object out of array of objects.
For example if there are several objects in one tile on the map and the player needs to be able to select one
specific unit on the stack. This is always defined in the UI theme-module
classitems.name: showSelections

params.name: objects
params.description: Objects that have been selected.

params.name: getDatas
params.description: This is an object made of functions, that get wanted data from the object. For example if you have objects name in object.data.specialData.name, then you have an object getDatas.name(), which retrieves this.

params.name: options
params.description: Extra options

classitems.description:
Resonsible for hignlighting the selected object. For example the unit that is being commanded. The hightlight
can mean e.g. bringing the unit on top on the map and showing selection circle around it.
classitems.name: highlightSelectedObject

params.name: object
params.description: Object that has been selected.

params.name: getDatas
params.description: This is an object made of functions, that get wanted data from the object. For example if you have objects name in object.data.specialData.name, then you have an object getDatas.name(), which retrieves this.

params.name: options
params.description: Extra options. Like dropping a shadow etc.

classitems.description: Shows arrow or movement or what ever to indicate the selected unit is moving to the given location
classitems.name: showUnitMovement

classitems.description: This is a general function which filters only highlightable object for use in UI operations
classitems.name: filterObjectsForHighlighting

classitems.description: Activates the eventListener.

throws.description: General error, if detector for this event type has not been set.

params.description: REQUIRED. The type of event. This type has been created with setDetector.

params.name: cb
params.description: REQUIRED. Callback to do it's eventlistener magic.

classitems.description: Deactivates the eventListener. Callback is optional. If is not provided will remove all this types eventListeners

params.name: type
params.description: REQUIRED. The type of event. This type has been created with setDetector.

params.name: cb

classitems.description:
Credits belong to: https://github.com/alforno-productions/HexPixiJs/blob/master/lib/hexPixi.js
Creates a hex shaped polygon that is used for the hex's hit area.
classitems.name: createHexagon

params.name: radius
params.description: Radius of the hexagon

params.name: options
params.description: Options, such as: isFlatTop (Boolean), is the heaxgon flat-topped

return.description: Hexagon shaped PIXI.Polygon object. That houses the hexagons corner points.

params.name: radius
params.description: Radius of the hexagon

params.name: options
params.description:
Options, such as:
                             color: The fill color of the hexagon
                             isFlatTop (Boolean), is the heaxgon flat-topped

return.description: Graphics object that is shaped as hexagon, based on given radius and options.

classitems.description:
This one checks the that the objects that should currently be visible in the viewport area are visible and outside
of the viewport objects are set .visible = false. This affect performance a lot. Basically when the map moves, we
set a check in the future based on the given intervalCheck milliseconds. And immediately after it we check if there
is another map movement. If there is we set another timeout. This works better with timeouts.

This uses webWorkers. They seemed to speed up the check, when timing with performance.now.
classitems.name: check

params.name: map
params.description: The current Map instance

params.description: Instance of Map

params.description: default = true

params.name: scale
params.description: default = 1 (equals to no defaul scale / no scale)
